intro: Bupleurum gaudianum, commonly known as the Alpine cicely, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, often at high elevations. Bupleurum gaudianum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
